episode_title: From Layoff to $250K: The 1-Person Agency Playbook with Zach Ashburn
transcript:
ï»¿Nikolas Hulewsky (00:01.469)
Okay, the reason I'm stoked to talk to you is because we're talking about my favorite way, and I'm not making this up, you can go search my Twitter history, my favorite way to get into entrepreneurship, which is finding something that you specialized in, that you're better than almost anybody else at, and then launching an agency business around that. Because a lot of people want to get into entrepreneurship, but they always think, I got to do the big sexy thing, I got to do a tech startup, I got to buy a company, I got to go sign an SBA loan. No, the easiest and most...


Predictably successful way to get into entrepreneurship is to build an agency around a specialized skill set that you have as an entrepreneur and you help entrepreneurs do that and think about How do I actually monetize this? How do I actually plan for it and achieve the result that I actually want? Is that right fair?


Zach Ashburn (00:47.81)
Yeah, that's exactly right. It's basically this bet that the corporate landscape continues to stretch horizontally and that real specialists are just primed to capitalize on the volatility and the innovation we're seeing right now. And that looks like taking what I'm doing in this corporate umbrella and doing independently as a consultant.
